Desc.entry: A registered charity that provides one-to-one advice and support to carers of people with severe mental illness. Provides a listening ear and gives emotional support, access to carers' support groups and men's group, support at Care Programme Approach (CPA) and ward rounds (if appropriate). Gives information about illnesses, treatment, medication and coping strategies. Also provides a Carers Education and Training Programme. Encourages carers to have a voice and gives information to assist carers on looking at options available to make informed choices. Also runs group meetings for carers. Health professional/Social Services referral.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm (office times), Saturday mornings (pre-arranged appointments); 1st Mon in the month, 1st Thurs evening in the month (carers groups), please contact for times
